alert.note: Alert for Benton; Carroll; Madison; Washington (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 17 at 2:17PM CST until December 17 at 6:45PM CST by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Arkansas, including the following counties, Benton, Carroll, Madison and Washington AR. * WHEN...Until 415 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 213 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated scattered showers and thunderstorms producing light to moderate rain. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen across the area from the earlier heavier downpours. - The current light to moderate rains should not worsen any ongoing urban or small stream flooding, but additional heavy rains are expected to develop by 3 to 4 pm that could worsen existing flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fayetteville... Springdale... Berryville... Huntsville... Eureka Springs... Farmington... Prairie Grove... Green Forest... Elkins... Tontitown... Bethel Heights... West Fork... Lincoln... Greenland... Hindsville... Wesley... Hobbs State Park... War Eagle... Clifty... Withrow Springs State Park... - This includes the following highways... Interstate 49 between mile markers 47 and 74. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
